skill.name: brand-guide
skill.description: Generate and maintain brand style guides - colors, fonts, imagery, voice/tone, responsive specs. Use when documenting brand identity or creating style guide pages.
skill.summary: Generate and maintain brand style guides - colors, fonts, imagery, voice/tone, responsive specs. Use...
skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: All 128 static findings are FALSE POSITIVEs. The backticks flagged as 'shell command execution' are markdown inline code delimiters. The 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags are RGB color values, font weights, and hex codes. This is a pure documentation skill with one Python utility script that reads CSS/PHP files and outputs brand data. No network calls, no sensitive data access, no obfuscation. Only accesses specified theme directories for reading. Low risk due to minimal attack surface.

content.value_statement: Brand documentation requires manual extraction and organization across multiple files. This skill generates comprehensive brand style guides with colors, typography, imagery, and voice guidelines extracted from your codebase.
actual_capabilities: Extract colors and fonts from CSS and PHP theme files
Generate brand guide documentation in Markdown format
Document responsive design breakpoints and behaviors
Create voice and tone guidelines with examples
Produce color swatches with hex and RGB values
Define typography scales with mobile and desktop sizes
limitations: Does not create visual design files (Figma, Sketch, PSD)
Requires manual review of extracted brand elements

use_cases.title: Document design systems
use_cases.description: Extract and organize brand elements from existing codebases into reusable style guides

use_cases.title: Build brand documentation
use_cases.description: Generate technical brand documentation for frontend implementations and theme development

use_cases.title: Maintain brand consistency
use_cases.description: Create reference materials ensuring voice, tone, and visual standards across channels

prompt_templates.title: Extract from theme
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brand-guide skill to extract brand colors and fonts from the WordPress theme at /path/to/theme and generate a brand guide

prompt_templates.title: Create from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a brand style guide for a new brand with primary color #1a365d, accent color #ed8936, primary font Inter, and voice that is professional and approachable

prompt_templates.title: Document breakpoints
prompt_templates.prompt: Add responsive design breakpoints documentation to the brand guide with mobile first approach

prompt_templates.title: Generate full guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete brand style guide including colors, typography, imagery guidelines, voice and tone, and responsive specifications

output_examples.input: Extract brand elements from our WordPress theme
Create brand guide for new company
output: Mobile: Default (no prefix), Tablet: md:, Desktop: lg:

best_practices: Run extract-brand.py on your actual theme to get accurate color values
Review and enhance extracted data with voice and tone guidelines
Keep brand guides updated when design changes are made
anti_patterns: Using brand guides without validating against actual code
Including colors that are not actually used in the product
Writing vague voice guidelines without concrete examples

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: It reads CSS and PHP files from WordPress themes. Output can be JSON, YAML, or Markdown.

faq.question: How many colors can it extract?
faq.answer: The script extracts all color values found in CSS custom properties, inline styles, and Tailwind classes.

faq.question: Does this skill work with non-WordPress themes?
faq.answer: Yes, it can analyze any CSS and PHP files for color and font definitions.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: All processing is local. The script only reads specified theme directories and outputs to your chosen location.

faq.question: Why are some colors missing from extraction?
faq.answer: Colors defined in JavaScript, SVG files, or image assets cannot be extracted by this script.

faq.question: How does this compare to Figma or Sketch libraries?
faq.answer: This skill generates text-based documentation. For visual design files, use Figma or Sketch directly.
